entries.content:
Starting new session with Moti on Sementix project. Recent context:
- We've built a VS Code extension that transforms Claude Code's terminal experience into a visual UI
- Major streaming system completed with real-time markdown formatting, tool visualization, and multi-turn support
- Recently fixed multi-turn streaming (ID-to-class conversion), tool positioning, and enhanced visual indicators
- Last identified roadmap: polish for Edit tool support, file management, cursor tracking, and duplicate prevention
- Architecture is ultra-modular with orchestrator patterns throughout
- Current git status: clean on master branch, recent commits include slide effect work and UI progress
Starting cleanup task: removing console logs and loggers from chat-controller module (src\ui\modules\ui-logic\ui-controllers\chat-controller). System is overloaded with logging statements.

Successfully completed chat-controller logging cleanup! Removed 59 console statements from 12 files:
- ToolRenderer.js (10)
- ToolTemplates.js (10) 
- ToolFormatter.js (4)
- SearchFormatter.js (6)
- ReadFormatter.js (6)
- ToolEventHandler.js (5)
- MessagePostProcessor.js (3)
- ToolChunkTransformer.js (3)
- IncompleteBufferRenderer.js (5)
- LineBufferManager.js (3)
- DOMReferences.js (3 console.error → logger)
- LegacyMethods.js (1 console.warn removed)

Only StreamingLogger.js retains console statements (intentional - it's the centralized logging service).

All console.log/warn/error replaced with either removal or conversion to this.logger where appropriate.

COMPREHENSIVE LOGGING ANALYSIS - tool-manager folder

SUMMARY STATISTICS:
- Total files analyzed: 26 JavaScript files
- Files WITH logging: 14 files
- Files WITHOUT logging: 12 files
- Total logger statements found: 99+
- Total console statements: 0

FILES WITH LOGGING (14 files):
1. ToolEventHandler.js - 22 statements (8 active, 14 commented out)
2. ToolElementUpdater.js - 25 statements
3. ToolFormatter.js - 18 statements
4. ToolManager.js - 2 statements
5. ToolStateManager.js - 12 statements
6. ToolUIUtils.js - 6 statements
7. SearchFormatter.js - 3 statements
8. ReadFormatter.js - 3 statements
9. EditFormatter.js - 3 statements
10. WriteFormatter.js - 3 statements
11. ToolDOMBuilder.js - 1 statement
12. PrimaryClickHandler.js - 4 statements
13. FileToolClickHandler.js - 2 statements
14. NonFileToolClickHandler.js - 3 statements
15. ContextMenuHandler.js - 1 statement
16. FileOpenResponseListener.js - 3 statements
17. ClipboardService.js - 3 statements
18. ToastFeedbackService.js - 1 statement

FILES WITHOUT LOGGING (12 files):
1. ToolRenderer.js
2. ToolClickHandler.js
3. ToolRenderer.original.js (backup)
4. ToolClickHandler.original.js (backup)
5. ToolClickHandler.refactored.js (backup)
6. ToolTemplates.js
7. ToolIconMapper.js
8. PathExtractor.js

Tool-manager cleanup progress: Phase 1 complete (25 statements removed), Phase 2 in progress (ToolFormatter.js: 18→2 statements). Removed all emoji-based debug logs and commented-out code. Keeping only essential warnings and errors.

Tool-manager cleanup COMPLETE! Summary of reductions:
- ToolEventHandler.js: 22 → 6 statements (removed 16: 14 commented + 2 emoji)
- ToolElementUpdater.js: 25 → 16 statements (removed 9 emoji debug logs)
- ToolFormatter.js: 18 → 2 statements (removed 16 delegation logs)
- ToolStateManager.js: 12 → 3 statements (removed 9 verbose debug logs)
- ToolUIUtils.js: 6 → 2 statements (removed 4 injection/scroll logs)
- EditFormatter.js: 3 → 0 statements (removed all)
- WriteFormatter.js: 3 → 0 statements (removed all)
- SearchFormatter.js: Already optimized (1 warn kept)
- ReadFormatter.js: Already optimized (1 warn kept)

Total reduction: ~50 statements removed from tool-manager folder.
